benchmark_details.name: MEDHALU (Medical Hallucination Detection Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: MEDHALU is a medical hallucination detection benchmark featuring diverse healthcare queries and corresponding LLM responses, annotated with hallucination types and text spans.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To study LLM hallucinations in real-world healthcare queries from patients and improve detection mechanisms.

data.source: Derived from HealthQA, LiveQA, and MedicationQA datasets, featuring healthcare questions answered by LLMs.
data.annotation: Labeled by medical experts annotating hallucination types and text spans.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of LLMs and medical experts in identifying hallucinations.
methodology.interpretation: A higher F1 Score indicates better performance in hallucination detection.
methodology.validation: Expert annotators provided evaluations, achieving a high Cohenâ€™s Kappa score, confirming reliability.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Participants provided informed consent prior to their participation.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Ethics committee approval was received for this research.
